title: 1950s Map Lettering
content:
I'm looking for font suggestions for the two handwritten 1950s style fonts in the headings of the attached map.  
Any ideas? I've had a look on several of the font repositories but not found anything matching well - particularly the strongly angled serifs on the second heading.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [r001bbp6.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405002651/http:/typophile.com/files/r001bbp6.jpg) | 535.58 KB |
author: spaceagle

comments.content:
Thin brushed angled serfis were popular in 1915 and I expect that some similar lettering has been digitized. A quick check turned up Clementhorpe [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/clementhorpe/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405002651/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/clementhorpe/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/clementhorpe/") which has similar serif treatment but pointing backwards instead of forwards.  
Don

Similar treatment, but by no means an exact match...

[http://www.1001freefonts.com/shangri\_la.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405002651/http:/www.1001freefonts.com/shangri_la.font "http://www.1001freefonts.com/shangri\_la.font")

Brushed spikey serifs but almost vertical, Charlemagne [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/charlemagne/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405002651/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/charlemagne/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/charlemagne/")  
From a lettering book circa 1912

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405002651im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RomanFrenchAndMeiklejohnEssentialsOfLettering1912_4264.jpg)
  
Don
